content: I have a project foo that has several local library crates it depends on, living in foo/components/bar. When I open foo in vscode, I get errors for foo and go to definition on types from bar takes me into the bar sources as expected, and I also get type information and go to definition in the bar sources as expected, but for some reason all errors are suppressed, and I have to use cargo check to see them. Opening bar in its own workspace makes the errors show up. I could have sworn this worked a few months ago, so maybe some option has appeared in the meantime? (A few months ago I was also periodically getting errors deep in std or other basic dependencies due to some fancy nightly-only macro, so perhaps the issue I'm hitting is a side effect of the fix for that.)
yeah, I've also noticed errors disappearing yesterday, looks like I broke the error mapping code again :(
Just ran into this in rust-analyzer itself, it would be great to find a small reproduction of this problem
meaning you still need a reproducer, or it's not a bug?
there's a bug somewhere for sure, but I can't even repro on the rust-analyzer commit that I had the issue on
